Package bridges.game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • bridges.game.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a board in a bridges game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board​(int width, int height)
      Creates a new Board instance.
      Board​(int width, int height, java.util.List<Island> islands, java.util.List<Bridge> bridges)
      Creates a new Board instance.

      Return a copy of this board.

      Returns a list of islands on this board.

      Check, if this board is complete.
      boolean isFullyConnected()
      Check, if the islands on the board are fully connected, that is, every island can be reached from any other island by walking along the bridges on the board.

      Return the neighbor of this island in the given direction or null.

      Partitions the board into groups of connected islands.

      Remove the given bridge or fail.

      Return a bridge from the given island in the given direction or null.

      Return a bridge, which connects both islands or null.

      Return a list of all neighbors, where we can actually build bridges to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board​(int width,
             int height)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Board instance.
        Parameters:
        width - - the (fixed) width of the board.
        height - - the (fixed) height of the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height are invalid.

      • Board

        public Board​(int width,
             int height,
             java.util.List<Island> islands,
             java.util.List<Bridge> bridges)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Board instance.
        Parameters:
        width - - the (fixed) width of the board.
        height - - the (fixed) height of the board.
        islands - - a list of islands to be added to the board.
        bridges - - a list of bridges to be added to the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height are invalid or if the islands or bridges have invalid coordinates.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public Board copy()
        Return a copy of this board.
        Returns:
        Board instance

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of this board.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of this board.

      • getIslandCount

        public int getIslandCount()
        Returns:
        The current island count of this board.

      • addIsland

        public void addIsland​(Island island)
        Adds an island to the board.
        Parameters:
        island - - the island to be placed on the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 1. the island doesn't fit onto this board (x or y too large) or 2. the island is placed directly next to another or on an island, which is already present on the board or

      • createBridge

        public Bridge createBridge​(Island island,
                           Direction dir)
        Create a bridge from the given island into the given direction without adding it. This method doesn't check, if the bridge would cause any conflicts when added.
        Parameters:
        island - the Island to start from.
        dir - the direction to build to.
        Returns:
        The newly created bridge or: null, if there is already a double bridge in this direction. null, if there is no neighbor in the given direction.

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd​(Bridge bridge)
        Check if the given bridge can be added to the board.
        Parameters:
        bridge - - the bridge to be checked.
        Returns:
        true, if it can be added, false otherwise.

      • bridges

        public java.util.List<Bridge> bridges​(Island island)
        Return all bridges on the board, which connect the given island.
        Parameters:
        island - - the island which has to be connected.
        Returns:
        All bridges on the board, which connect the given island.

      • bridges

        public java.util.List<Bridge> bridges()
        Return all bridges on the board.
        Returns:
        All bridges on the board.

      • getIslandAt

        public Island getIslandAt​(int x,
                          int y)
        Return the island at the given board position or null.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the island.
        y - The y coordinate of the island.
        Returns:
        The island at the given position or null, if no island is present.

      • getIslands

        public java.util.List<Island> getIslands()
        Returns a list of islands on this board. The returned list can be manipulated freely while the board state stays unchanged.

      • searchBridge

        public Bridge searchBridge​(Island island1,
                           Island island2)
        Return a bridge, which connects both islands or null.
        The order of the islands does not matter, so searchBridge(a, b) is the same as searchBridge(b, a).

        It also doesn't matter, if the island is part of the board. This simply results in returning null.
        Parameters:
        island1 - - the first island.
        island2 - - the second island.
        Returns:
        A bridge, which connects both islands or null.

      • searchBridge

        public Bridge searchBridge​(Island island,
                           Direction dir)
        Return a bridge from the given island in the given direction or null.
        Parameters:
        island - - the island to start from.
        dir - - the direction to go into.
        Returns:
        A bridge with the given criteria or null.

      • addBridge

        public void addBridge​(Bridge bridge)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the given bridge to the board, if possible.

        Note: This allows to add bridges, which cross other bridges already on the board.
        Parameters:
        bridge - - the bridge to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the two islands of the bridge aren't neighbors or the bridge cannot replace an already existing bridge (e.g. trying to replace a double bridge with a single).

      • removeOneBridge

        public Bridge removeOneBridge​(Bridge bridge)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Remove the given bridge or fail.

        Note: This will replace double bridges on the board with single bridges.
        Parameters:
        bridge - - the bridge to remove.
        Returns:
        The bridge, which replaced the old one (if it was a double bridge) or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the bridge isn't part of this board.

      • neighbor

        public Island neighbor​(Island island,
                       Direction direction)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the neighbor of this island in the given direction or null. The result of the method does not depend on the bridges on the board.
        Parameters:
        island - - island to find a neighbor for.
        direction - - Direction, in which a neighbor is looked for.
        Returns:
        the island next to this one in the given direction or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the island is not present on this board.

      • neighbors

        public java.util.List<Island> neighbors​(Island island)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return a list of all neighbors of the given island on the board. The result of this method does not depend on the bridges on the board.
        Parameters:
        island - The island for which we return the neighbors.
        Returns:
        List of all neighbors.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if island is null.

      • validNeighbors

        public java.util.List<Island> validNeighbors​(Island island)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return a list of all neighbors, where we can actually build bridges to. The result of this method depends on the bridges, that are present on the board.
        Parameters:
        island - The island for which we return the neighbors.
        Returns:
        A list of all valid neighbors of the island.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - passed on from getAllNeighbors().

      • getIncomplete

        public java.util.List<Island> getIncomplete()
        Return a list of islands, which have less bridges than required.
        Returns:
        The list of islands.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Check, if this board is complete.
        Returns:
        True, if all islands have exactly the required count of bridges and the board is fully connected, false otherwise.

      • isFullyConnected

        public boolean isFullyConnected()
        Check, if the islands on the board are fully connected, that is, every island can be reached from any other island by walking along the bridges on the board.
        Returns:
        true, if every island can be reached, false otherwise.

      • partition

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<Island>> partition()
        Partitions the board into groups of connected islands.

        For a board without any bridges one gets: partition().size() == getIslandCount().
        For a board that is fully conneted one gets: partition().size() == 1.
        Returns:
        A list of list of islands, which are connected.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the game (that is: removes all bridges on the board).
